filesystem.description: File system operations for reading and writing files

fetch.description: HTTP fetch operations for API calls and web scraping

database-sqlite.description: SQLite database operations for local data persistence
database-sqlite.notes: Enable when you need local database functionality. Database file will be created at ./local.db
database-sqlite.setup: No additional setup required. Enable in mcp.json and database will be created automatically.

database-postgres.description: PostgreSQL database operations for production databases

search.description: Web search capabilities using Brave Search API
search.setup: Get free API key from https://brave.com/search/api/ and add to .env file

github.description: GitHub API integration for repository operations, issues, and PRs
github.notes: Requires GITHUB_TOKEN environment variable with appropriate scopes
github.setup: Create personal access token at https://github.com/settings/tokens with repo scope

memory.description: Persistent memory and context storage for AI agents
memory.notes: Useful for maintaining context across sessions and conversations
memory.setup: Enable in mcp.json. Memory will be stored in .mcp-memory directory (gitignored)

puppeteer.description: Browser automation for testing, scraping, and screenshots
puppeteer.notes: Requires Chrome/Chromium to be installed on the system
puppeteer.setup: Enable in mcp.json. Puppeteer will download Chrome automatically on first use.

aws.description: AWS cloud services integration (S3, Lambda, DynamoDB, etc.)
aws.notes: Requires AWS credentials with appropriate IAM permissions
aws.setup: Configure AWS credentials in .env file or use AWS CLI credentials

docker.notes: Requires Docker to be installed and running
docker.setup: Install Docker Desktop or Docker Engine. Enable in mcp.json.

slack.description: Slack integration for messaging and notifications
slack.notes: Requires Slack app with bot token and signing secret
slack.setup: Create Slack app at https://api.slack.com/apps and add credentials to .env

notes.usage: Enable servers by setting 'enabled': true in their configuration
notes.security: Never commit .env file with actual API keys to version control
notes.performance: Only enable servers you actively use to minimize resource usage
notes.updates: MCP servers are pulled from npm using npx -y, so you always get the latest version
